author: James Martin
method: Place the peas, onion, garlic and mint leaves into a food processor and blend to a thick purée. Add the yoghurt and blend again, leaving the mixture slightly lumpy. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the chilli, cumin, coriander and lime juice and season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Spoon into a serving bowl and drizzle with the olive oil. Serve with a bowl of nachos alongside for dipping.
ingredients: 450g/1lb frozen petit pois or peas, defrosted and drained,  ½ red onion, finely chopped,  1 garlic clove, finely chopped,  1 small bunch fresh mint leaves,  115g/4oz plain yoghurt,  ½ red chilli, seeds removed, finely chopped,  1 tsp ground cumin,  ½ tsp ground coriander,  1 lime, juice only,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil,  1 large bag ready-made nachos
